title: Rococo letters
content:
Anybody have a resource with more letters in this style: [http://houseind.com/showandtell/images/287.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20141230235910/http:/houseind.com/showandtell/images/287.jpg "http://houseind.com/showandtell/images/287.jpg") ?  
posted on the House Industries blog today... love it, would like to see the rest of the alphabet.

thanks  
Josh
author: scruggsdesign

comments.content: _Bizarre & Ornamental Alphabets_, edited by Carol Belanger Grafton (New York: Dover Books, 1981); and _Decorative Alphabets and Initials_, edited by Alexander Nesbitt (New York: Dover Books, 1959). Both books originally sold for $4.00 or less, and you ought to be able to find them on eBay or amazon.com.

There's a book called Alphabets printed by some french library that has a lot of decorative initials, its very recent (2000), 384 pages and its very easy to find, altough I'm not finding any link to it right now. :(

Emiliano Amadei

[http://www.abebooks.com/servlet/BookDetailsPL?bi=683100827&searchurl=sts...](http://web.archive.org/web/20141230235910/http:/www.abebooks.com/servlet/BookDetailsPL?bi=683100827&searchurl=sts%3Dt%26an%3DL%2527Aventurine%26y%3D16%26x%3D30 "http://www.abebooks.com/servlet/BookDetailsPL?bi=683100827&searchurl=sts%3Dt%26an%3DL%2527Aventurine%26y%3D16%26x%3D30")

I have a copy of this book, it's really good as refference.

Emiliano Amadei
